trans-unit.source: Determines the border padding for docked controls.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges> class creates a margin on a given edge or all edges of a docked control.

You can set the width of this margin for each individual edge by setting the following properties: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Bottom%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Top%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Left%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.Right%2A>.
Alternatively, you can set all the edges to the same width simultaneously by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges.All%2A> property.
If the size of the control is too large for its container, the control will be resized to fit in the container, minus the specified margin width.
Gets or sets the padding width for all edges of a docked control.
The padding width assigned to this property is applied to all edges of the docked control.
The padding width, in pixels.
Gets or sets the padding width for the bottom edge of a docked control.
The padding width assigned to this property is applied only to the bottom edge of the docked control.
The padding width, in pixels.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges"></xref> object.
The object to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.DockPaddingEdges"></xref> object.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Gets or sets the padding width for the left edge of a docked control.
The padding width assigned to this property is applied only to the left edge of the docked control.
The padding width, in pixels.
Gets or sets the padding width for the right edge of a docked control.
The padding width assigned to this property is applied only to the right edge of the docked control.
The padding width, in pixels.
Gets or sets the padding width for the top edge of a docked control.
The padding width assigned to this property is applied only to the top edge of the docked control.
The padding width, in pixels.
Returns an empty string.
An empty string.
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
A new object that is a copy of the current instance.
